rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;79a9ebd0.1503">   <title>TAKING THE PLUNGE-ART LIBRARIANSHIP AS A CAREER OPTION-20th April 2015-London, INIVA </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;79a9ebd0.1503</link>   <description> *with apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>TAKING THE PLUNGE: ART LIBRARIANSHIP AS A CAREER OPTION<br>ARLIS/UK &amp; Ireland Workshop<br>DATE Monday 20th April 2015<br>TIME 10.00 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 16.00<br>VENUE Stuart Hall Library, Iniva, Rivington Place, London EC2A 3BA<br><br>The Arlis Professional Development Committee has organised this workshop, designed for new professionals, LIS students or anyone thinking about becoming an art librarian. The day includes many interesting presentations by experts in their field, and useful advice on how to present your CV in the best way. The event concludes with a tour of the Stuart Hall Library (INIVA). Please see the full programme [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-04T10:27:22+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alessia Borri</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;79a9ebd0.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;39928b1b.1502">   <title>ARLIS visit to Goldsmiths Special Collections-FULLY BOOKED- </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;39928b1b.1502</link>   <description> *with apologies for cross posting*<br><br>The ARLIS Professional Development Committee has organised a visit to Goldsmiths Special Collections, The Textile Collection and Women's Art Library, in London.<br><br>*PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS VISIT IS NOW FULLY BOOKED*<br><br>Alessia Borri<br>Assistant Academic Support Librarian<br><br>University of the Arts London<br>Chelsea College of Arts<br><br>E: a.borri@chelsea.arts.ac.uk&lt;mailto:a.borri@chelsea.arts.ac.uk&gt;<br>T:0207 514 7901<br>@Chelsea_Library<br>[twitter-icon (1)]&lt;https://twitter.com/UAL_Libraries&gt; [facebook] &lt;https://www.facebook.com/UALlibraries&gt; [wordpress-icon] &lt;http://blogs.arts.ac.uk/libraryservices/&gt; [ask_us_icon_blue tinier] &lt;http://arts.ac.libanswers.com/index.php&gt;   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-27T09:18:08+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alessia Borri</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;39928b1b.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;3958d722.1502">   <title>Avant-Gardes Now! An Interdisciplinary Symposium on Avant-Garde Studies and Practice </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;3958d722.1502</link>   <description> *Avant-Gardes Now!, Friday 1 May 2015, 1-7pm, Oxford Brookes University*<br><br>John Henry Brookes Building 204, Gipsy Lane Campus<br>http://www.brookes.ac.uk/poetry-centre/projects/avant-gardes-now!-symposium/<br><br>A poster is attached - please display it where possible!<br><br>Hosted by the Oxford Brookes Poetry Centre<br>&lt;http://www.brookes.ac.uk/poetry-centre/&gt;, and formulated in part as a more<br>specific response to the 2014 BAMS Conference 'Modernism<br>Now!', 'Avant-Gardes Now!' will address topics which are relevant both to<br>interdisciplinary and international avant-garde studies and creative<br>practice, and also to the UK research and funding environment. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T10:38:42+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Niall Munro</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;3958d722.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;a4cdfdab.1502">   <title>Announcing the 50th Title from MuseumsEtc: Photography and Urban History </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;a4cdfdab.1502</link>   <description> STREET LIFE IN LONDON: John Thomson and Adolphe Smith's Masterpiece of<br>Photography and Urban History<br><br>&quot;The first concerted body of work to deal with life on the streets of a<br>major European or American city.&quot;<br><br>For our 50th title we're thrilled to be publishing a brand-new edition of<br>this innovative and hugely influential work - pioneering in its use of<br>ethnological recording, of documentary photography, and as &quot;one of the most<br>far-reaching photobooks in the medium's history&quot;. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-16T15:36:04-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Graeme Farnell</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;a4cdfdab.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;79ff02d2.1502">   <title>CfP Reminder: Material Culture in Action - 7-8 September 2015 - Glasgow School of Art </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;79ff02d2.1502</link>   <description> Call for Papers:<br><br>Material Culture in Action:<br>Practices of making, collecting and re-enacting art and design<br><br>Glasgow School of Art, UK<br>DATES: 7-8 September 2015,<br><br>Keynote speakers:<br>Prof Guy Julier<br>Prof Esther Leslie<br>Ian Helliwell<br><br>Closing remarks by Prof Tim Ingold<br><br>This two-day international conference will investigate new directions in material culture studies by focusing on creative, critical and theoretical engagement with the material culture of art and design, both within and beyond the art school. The material culture of art and design covers a wide range of art practices, from professionally designed works within the art school, to the [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-16T12:17:12-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Roy ,Elodie Amandine</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;79ff02d2.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;cf549ff6.1502">   <title>CfP: 'Fashion and Art History', AAH Summer Symposium, York, 29-30 June 2015, Deadline: 27.3.2015 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;cf549ff6.1502</link>   <description> The Association of Art Historians (AAH) Summer Symposium is a two-day annual conference highlighting post-graduate research. It takes place at a different university each year in early Summer.<br><br>'Fashion &amp; Art History\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br>University of York<br>29 - 30 June 2015<br><br>Fashion and art often follow a shared trajectory of social, political, and historical circumstances. In collaboration with the University of York, the AAH\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds annual Student Summer Symposium will explore the relationship between fashion and art, by inviting papers that engage with this subject across a wide range of chronological and theoretical perspectives.<br>The influence of fashionable dress on artists and [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-13T15:37:52+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>SUBSCRIBE AAH-HE-ISSUES Anonymous</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;cf549ff6.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;e839600c.1501">   <title>Silver Stories International Conference Leiria </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;e839600c.1501</link>   <description>Full message available at: <a href="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;e839600c.1501">Silver Stories International Conference Leiria </a></description>   <dc:date>2015-01-25T22:56:24+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Silver Stories</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;e839600c.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;1acaf810.1501">   <title>Lecture series - Aesthetics and Display of Islamic Art </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;1acaf810.1501</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br><br>Please find below information about the lecture series on Aesthetics and Display of Islamic Art (20 Jan-17 March), which I hope will be of interest, and my apologies about cross-posting.<br><br>The second semester of IESA's year-long lecture programme on Collecting, Communicating and Display of Islamic Art starts tomorrow. The strand is devoted to Aesthetics and Display of Islamic Art, and will examine the different media of the art of the Islamic world: architecture, glass, ceramics, metalwork and painting. However, instead of focusing on particular periods and geographical areas, following a chronological order, as done by most traditional courses, [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-19T17:21:36+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Aliya Sayakhova</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;1acaf810.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;cfe3e292.1501">   <title>ARLIS visit to the RHS Lindley Library, London-Wednesday 28 January 2.30 pm. </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;cfe3e292.1501</link>   <description> *with many apologies for cross posting*<br><br>The ARLIS Professional Development Committee has organised a visit to the Royal Horticultural Society\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Lindley Library, in Pimlico, London.<br><br>The library holds unique collections of early printed books on gardening, botanical art and photographs. It also holds the archives of the RHS and personal archives of notable gardeners and garden designers. It is advisable to book early as there is only room for up to 12 delegates. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-15T14:40:42+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alessia Borri</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;cfe3e292.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;9e903943.1501">   <title>William Blake in the Desolate Market </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;9e903943.1501</link>   <description> Dear AAH-HE-ISSUES subscribers,<br><br>We hope you find these titles of interest<br><br>[9780773543065]&lt;http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/william-blake-in-the-desolate-market&gt;William Blake in the Desolate Market<br>G.E. Bentley Jr<br>&quot;&quot;The effort that produced William Blake in the Desolate Market is that of a lifetime, gathering for the first time, in concentrated fashion, every interaction and transaction Blake had with an often indifferent marketplace and its agents. It will be of serious pragmatic use for the next generation of Blake scholars.&quot;-Mark Lussier, Department of English, Arizona State University<br>"William Blake and the Desolate Market is a gem that will be welcomed, appreciated, and widely used and cited by scholars from [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-08T11:34:32+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Charles Woodhead</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;9e903943.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;ff62019f.1501">   <title>Ireland International Conference on Education (IICE-2015): Call for Submissions! </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;ff62019f.1501</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-postings.<br><br>Kindly email this call for papers to your colleagues,<br>faculty members and postgraduate students.<br><br>Call for Papers, Extended Abstracts, Posters, Tutorials and Workshops!   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-07T14:15:13+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>L inda Woods</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;ff62019f.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;20a4932a.1412">   <title>CFP: Material Culture in Action - 7-8 September 2015, Glasgow School of Art, UK </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;20a4932a.1412</link>   <description> Material Culture in Action:<br>Practices of making, collecting and re-enacting art and design<br><br>DATES: 7-8 September 2015,<br><br>Keynote speakers:<br>Prof Guy Julier<br>Prof Esther Leslie<br>Ian Helliwell<br><br>Glasgow School of Art, UK<br><br>This two-day international conference will investigate new directions in material culture studies by focusing on creative, critical and theoretical engagement with the material culture of art and design, both within and beyond the art school. The material culture of art and design covers a wide range of art practices, from professionally designed works within the art school, to the less official works of the self-taught amateur. An emphasis [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-23T14:51:40-00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Roy ,Elodie Amandine</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;20a4932a.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;c908fe1b.1412">   <title>2nd Call for Contributions: 4th International Visual Methods conference </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;c908fe1b.1412</link>   <description> The University of Brighton is delighted to host the Fourth International Visual Methods Conference in September 2015. Our programme builds on the foundations laid by the three successful Visual Methods conferences that have taken place at the Open University and the University of Leeds in the UK and at Victoria University in Wellington New Zealand over the past six years. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-12-16T13:36:36+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Visual Methods</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;c908fe1b.1412</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;ffaff1dd.1411">   <title>Cutting Edge 2015 - Multidisciplinary Postgraduate Conference </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;ffaff1dd.1411</link>   <description> Mita Lad<br>PhD/GTA in Media<br>Edge Hill University<br>Ormskirk<br>mita.lad@edgehill.ac.uk<br><br>Cutting Edge 2015: Answers to the Great Question of Life, the Universe and Everything.<br>Postgraduate Conference - call for papers is open. Please visit our website: http://www.edgehill.ac.uk/graduateschool/conference-cutting-edge-2015/ - for more information.    </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-27T14:53:17+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mita Lad</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;ffaff1dd.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;8ac0663d.1411">   <title>neurocreator Journal - neuroscience + art + coaching + media + creative industries... </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;8ac0663d.1411</link>   <description> *apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>Hello Creators,<br><br>the inaugural journal of Neurocreator introduces a different way of looking<br>at how creators do what we do.<br><br>From the traditions of general semantics, neuro-linguistics, changework<br>therapies and the latest explorations of neuroscience comes an approach<br>that is already transforming creators' lives.<br><br>For instance, the concepts of inspiration and the muse are based on very<br>old ideas - such as the belief system of the Roman Empire and their gods!<br>Surely in the 21st Century we can get closer to the reality of the creative<br>process? [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-19T21:24:46+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Mal Williamson</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;8ac0663d.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;cb3c049d.1411">   <title>ARLIS workshop "an introduction to art & design reference resources" - 15 December 2014, National Art Library, V&A, London </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;cb3c049d.1411</link>   <description> *with apologies for cross posting*<br><br>AN INTRODUCTION TO ART &amp; DESIGN REFERENCE RESOURCES<br>ARLIS/UK &amp; Ireland Workshop<br><br>The ARLIS Professional Development Committee presents this workshop, aimed to those new to the world of art librarianship, or those wishing to update their skills in art and design enquiry work. The day features presentations from leading art and design librarians, who will provide up-to-date information on the key print and electronic resources and strategies for effective research enquiry work. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-11-04T16:02:35+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alessia Borri</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;cb3c049d.1411</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;9ec17ca5.1411">   <title>CFP \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdMaking Autonomy: Design, Material and Visual culture in Latin America\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;9ec17ca5.1411</link>   <description> CALL FOR PAPERS<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdMaking Autonomy: Design, Material and Visual culture in Latin America\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br><br>Organised by Dr. Livia Rezende (V&amp;A/RCA History of Design Programme, Royal College of Art, London, UK) &amp; (The Photobook: A<br>History). In its pages, journalist Adolphe Smith and photographer John<br>Thomson aimed to reveal, through the innovative use of photography and<br>essays, the conditions of a life of poverty in London. The University of Brighton offers a unique context for the conference, as it brings long-standing traditions of visual arts practice into a dynamic relationship with critical research and scholarship. We believe this will be a productive and intellectually expansive environment in which to extend the visual methods debate within and beyond the academy. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-24T16:22:27+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Visual Methods</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;3e64377c.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;5357a725.1410">   <title>ARLIS visit to the Colour Reference Library at the Royal College of Art-19th November-2.30 pm </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;5357a725.1410</link>   <description> *with apologies for cross-posting*<br><br>The ARLIS Professional Development Committee has organised a visit to the Colour Reference Library at the Royal College of Art, London.<br><br>The visit will take place on 19th November, it will start at 2.30 until approximately 4.30.<br><br>The Colour Reference Library (CRL) at the Royal College of Art is one of the largest and most comprehensive collections of colour-related publications in the world. Containing nearly two thousand books, together with pamphlets, swatches and journals, the library covers numerous aspects of the vast field of colour-based studies, encompassing art and science, theory and practice. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-23T08:48:48+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Alessia Borri</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;5357a725.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;33dde764.1410">   <title>Islamic Art lecture series at Leighton House Museum: four sessions on Orientalism (04/11-02/12) </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;33dde764.1410</link>   <description> Lecture series<br><br>Collecting and Display of the Arts of the Islamic World<br>&lt;http://www.iesa.edu/iesa-london/programs/studyprogrammes&gt;<br><br>Orientalism (04/11-02/12)<br><br>The last four sessions of this semester in the lecture series on the<br>Collecting<br>and Display of the Arts ofthe Islamic World<br>&lt;http://www.iesa.edu/iesa-london/programs/studyprogrammes&gt;will concentrate<br>on the enormous interest in Islamic art that developed in the 19th century.<br>We will be covering topics ranging from Orientalism and the influences on<br>the work of John Frederick Lewis to the collecting in public and private<br>museums in England and France. The final session will focus on the impact<br>of Islamic art in Europe by taking three major exhibitions [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2014-10-22T17:46:27+01:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Aliya Sayakhova</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;33dde764.1410</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;1d443927.1410">   <title>Call for Submissions - Re-imagining Rural Mythologies </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=AAH-HE-ISSUES;1d443927.1410</link>   <description> Re-imagining Rural Mythologies<br>Call for Submissions<br>6th Nordic Geographers Meeting, Tallinn &amp; Tartu, Estonia, 15 \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd 19 June 2015<br><br>Even in cities, encounters with the countryside texture our daily routines. Whether we buy an organic chicken sandwich at lunch-time, wash our clothes in \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdMeadow Fresh\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd fabric conditioner, or daydream about escaping the pressures of modern living amid the beauty, fresh air and tranquility of the countryside, popular perceptions of the rural permeate our lives. Yet, how do such bucolic notions hold up against reality? How, and through which processes, are rural mythologies perpetuated?
